page.title: 02VILLAGES 1 FORD END.
page.content: {Ford End}is one of the largest villages in Gt.Waltham parish.It has a {population}of approximately 400 and about 150 houses.There is also a church,a primary school,a village hall,a cricket pitch,two phone boxes,a sub_post office and three pubs.The school is quite small,with only 40 children from 5 to 11.A library van comes to the village every Tuesday afternoon.There is one main road running through the village,the Chelmsford to Dunmow,and many small lanes and footpaths.The{River Chelmer flows east of the village.Most of the area is used for farming of different sorts,corn,fruit,rape and some animals .Willows are grown along the river banks.The fields are divided by hedges as the only local rocks are flint,clay and gravel.
